©ashleymaglich *the picture below is how it would look if you did your single_crochet stitches on the right side of the stocking like i mentioned earlier whatever way you prefer i like them both once that is done i personally like to sew in all my loose ends at this point because the next step is to turn your work inside out if that s the route you decided to go ©ashleymaglich *the picture below is the stocking turned seam side in so you can see the difference *this is what it looks like with the single_crochet stitches flipped inside the stocking* ©ashleymaglich top border of the stocking in between the granny clusters you are going to make 1/2 double_crochet 2dc 1/2 double_crochet all in that same space then you will single_crochet in the middle stitch of the next 3dc cluster i like to flip my stocking with the l shape facing the opposite way with the toe pointing to the left insert your hook into the middle stitch of the first 3dc ch1 & single_crochet back into that same stitch in the space between the 3dc clusters you will make 1/2dc 2dc 1/2dc in the same space then single_crochet in the middle of the 3dc ©ashleymaglich repeat this all the way around you will have to make a cluster in the back of the stocking check the next photo for reference *you are going to make your last 1/2dc 2dc 1/2dc cluster in the same stitch as the first single_crochet where you stitched your stocking together slip_stitch into the first single_crochet ch1 & fo ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich the toe you will be attaching your yarn in the middle double_crochet of the 3dc cluster of the toe as shown in photo below round 1 ch1 single_crochet in that same stitch single_crochet in the next stitch skip the next stitch & repeat all the way around single_crochet next 2 stitches skip the next ©ashleymaglich when you have 24 stitches you will now be at the bottom of the stocking you will place a single_crochet on each side of the single_crochet where you stitched the stocking together *pictured below* slip_stitch in the first single_crochet & ch1 you should have 26 stitches ©ashleymaglich round 2 1/2dc in that same stitch 1/2dc next 2 stitches 2 1/2dc in the next repeat that all the way around until you have 2 stitches left 1/2dc nxt 3 2 1/2dc nxt make a 1 1/2dc in each of the last 2 stitches 32 stitches slip_stitch into first 1/2dc ch1 ©ashleymaglich round 3 1/2dc in the next 2 stitches 1/2dc 2 together repeat all the way around 24 stitches slip_stitch in the first 1/2dc ch1 ©ashleymaglich round 4 1/2dc 1/2dc 2 together repeat all the way around 16 stitches
